arr_sildes.Heading: Baahubali: The Beginning (2015)
Content: Epic historical action-drama film directed by S. S. Rajamouli.
Starring Prabhas, Rana Daggubati, Anushka Shetty, Tamannaah Bhatia.
Story of two brothers fighting for the kingdom of Mahishmati.
Grossed over ₹650 crore worldwide, becoming the highest-grossing Indian film at the time.
Won 6 National Film Awards, including Best Film and Best Director.

arr_sildes.Heading: Baahubali 2: The Conclusion (2017)
Content: Sequel to Baahubali: The Beginning.
Continues the story of the brothers and the battle for Mahishmati.
Grossed over ₹1,800 crore worldwide, becoming the highest-grossing Indian film ever.
Won 5 National Film Awards, including Best Film and Best Director.
Concluded the epic Baahubali franchise.

arr_sildes.Heading: Ala Vaikunthapurramuloo (2020)
Content: Family drama and action film directed by Trivikram Srinivas.
Starring Allu Arjun, Pooja Hegde, Tabu, Jayaram.
Story of a middle-class boy who is mistaken for the son of a millionaire.
Grossed over ₹260 crore worldwide, becoming one of the highest-grossing Telugu films of all time.
Received critical acclaim for its performances, direction, and music.

arr_sildes.Heading: Pushpa: The Rise (2021)
Content: Action drama film directed by Sukumar.
Starring Allu Arjun, Rashmika Mandanna, Fahadh Faasil.
Story of a lorry driver who becomes involved in the illegal red sanders trade.
Grossed over ₹300 crore worldwide, becoming one of the highest-grossing Telugu films of all time.
Known for its action sequences, performances, and soundtrack.

arr_sildes.Heading: Saaho (2019)
Content: Action thriller film directed by Sujeeth.
Starring Prabhas, Shraddha Kapoor, Neil Nitin Mukesh.
Story of a police officer investigating a series of robberies.
Grossed over ₹400 crore worldwide, making it one of the most expensive Indian films ever made.
Received mixed reviews for its action sequences and performances.

arr_sildes.Heading: Rangasthalam (2018)
Content: Period drama film directed by Sukumar.
Starring Ram Charan, Samantha Akkineni, Aadhi Pinisetty.
Story of a deaf-mute farmer who fights against a corrupt landlord.
Grossed over ₹200 crore worldwide, becoming one of the highest-grossing Telugu films of the year.
Acclaimed for its performances, direction, and social commentary.

arr_sildes.Heading: Arjun Reddy (2017)
Content: Romantic drama film directed by Sandeep Reddy Vanga.
Starring Vijay Deverakonda, Shalini Pandey.
Story of a young surgeon who struggles with alcoholism and drug addiction after losing his girlfriend.
Grossed over ₹50 crore worldwide, becoming a sleeper hit and earning critical acclaim for its performances and direction.
Remade in several languages, including Bollywood's Kabir Singh.

arr_sildes.Heading: Fidaa (2017)
Content: Romantic drama film directed by Sekhar Kammula.
Starring Varun Tej, Sai Pallavi.
Story of a young couple from different cultures who fall in love and face societal challenges.
Grossed over ₹100 crore worldwide, becoming a commercial and critical success.
Acclaimed for its performances, direction, and music.

arr_sildes.Heading: Jersey (2019)
Content: Sports drama film directed by Gowtam Tinnanuri.
Starring Nani, Shraddha Srinath.
Story of a former cricketer who returns to the sport to fulfill his son's dream.
Grossed over ₹200 crore worldwide, becoming one of the highest-grossing Telugu films of the year.
Acclaimed for its performances, direction, and emotional impact.

arr_sildes.Heading: Uppena (2021)
Content: Romantic drama film directed by Buchi Babu Sana.
Starring Vaishnav Tej, Krithi Shetty.
Story of a young couple from different castes who fall in love and face societal opposition.
Grossed over ₹150 crore worldwide, becoming a commercial success.
Acclaimed for its performances, direction, and realistic portrayal of caste issues.
